Home / Services / Restorative Dentistry

Crowns & Bridges

Restore damaged teeth with crowns or replace missing teeth with bridges. On-site fabrication for single appointment completion.

Complete Tooth Restoration

Crowns protect broken or weakened teeth, while bridges replace missing teeth. With our on-site fabrication equipment, many restorations can be completed in a single appointment.

Dental Crowns

A crown is a cap that completely covers a damaged, cracked, or severely decayed tooth. It restores the tooth's shape, size, strength, and appearance.

When You Need a Crown:

  • • Large cavity that's too big for a filling
  • • Cracked or broken tooth
  • • Tooth weakened by root canal treatment
  • • Severe tooth wear or grinding damage
  • • Cosmetic improvement of misshapen teeth

Dental Bridges

A bridge literally bridges the gap created by one or more missing teeth. It consists of crowns on adjacent teeth with a replacement tooth in between.

Benefits of Bridges:

  • • Restore your ability to chew and speak properly
  • • Maintain facial shape and prevent sagging
  • • Prevent remaining teeth from shifting
  • • Distribute bite forces evenly
  • • Restore your confident smile

Crown & Bridge Materials

All-Porcelain/Ceramic

Advantages:

  • • Most natural-looking option
  • • Excellent color matching
  • • Metal-free and biocompatible
  • • No dark lines at the gum

Best For:

  • • Front teeth (highly visible areas)
  • • Patients with metal allergies
  • • Those wanting the most natural appearance

Porcelain-Fused-to-Metal (PFM)

Advantages:

  • • Strong and durable
  • • Good aesthetics
  • • Proven track record
  • • Cost-effective option

Best For:

  • • Back teeth (heavy chewing forces)
  • • Long-span bridges
  • • Budget-conscious patients

Gold Alloy

Advantages:

  • • Extremely durable and long-lasting
  • • Gentle on opposing teeth
  • • Precise fit
  • • Biocompatible

Best For:

  • • Back teeth (not visible when smiling)
  • • Patients who grind their teeth
  • • Maximum longevity

The Treatment Process

Traditional Process (2 visits)

1

Preparation & Impressions

Tooth preparation, impressions, temporary crown

2

Final Placement

Remove temporary, place permanent crown/bridge (2-3 weeks later)

CEREC Same-Day (1 visit)

1

Digital Preparation

Tooth preparation and digital scanning

2

Design & Mill

Computer design and in-office milling

3

Immediate Placement

Placement and final adjustments (same day!)

Caring for Your Crown or Bridge

Daily Care

  • Brush twice daily with fluoride toothpaste
  • Floss daily (special floss threaders for bridges)
  • Use an antimicrobial mouthwash
  • Regular dental checkups every 6 months

Avoid

  • Chewing ice, hard candy, or nuts
  • Using teeth as tools to open packages
  • Grinding or clenching teeth (wear a night guard)
  • Sticky foods that can pull off crowns

Restore Your Smile's Function & Beauty

Don't let damaged or missing teeth compromise your oral health and confidence. Our crowns and bridges provide long-lasting solutions that look and feel natural.

Frequently Asked Questions

How long do crowns and bridges last?

With proper care, dental crowns typically last 10-15 years, while bridges can last 10-20 years. Factors like oral hygiene, eating habits, and regular dental visits significantly impact longevity.

Will my crown or bridge look natural?

Absolutely! We carefully match the color, shape, and size of your crowns and bridges to your natural teeth. Modern materials like all-ceramic crowns are virtually indistinguishable from natural teeth.

Is the crown procedure painful?

We use local anesthesia to ensure you're comfortable during the procedure. Some sensitivity is normal for a few days after treatment, but most patients experience minimal discomfort that's easily managed with over-the-counter pain relievers.

What's the difference between a crown and a bridge?

A crown covers and protects a single damaged tooth. A bridge replaces one or more missing teeth by connecting crowns on adjacent teeth with replacement teeth in between. Both restore function and appearance.
